Posts.Content: Hi Zam Zam, I remember asking the same question and was advised to drink peppermint tea, it worked for me. Good luck with your treatments, I'm finished mine now and doing really well xx
Posts.Title: Chemo farts

Posts.Content: Hi Tray, I think I was luckier than you as my feet and hands peeled badly during the t part of fec-t so they reduced my dose and it soon got better I finished chemo end of August and my feet are still weird, sort of numb but not painful, I just wanted to say my chemo nurse recommended udderly cream, I could only find it on line and at varying prices but I do recommend it and yes I believe it was first used for cows udders! or maybe they were just pulling my leg. I really couldn't walk at all for a few days and this cream worked well on the peeling. My toenails are still a mess and I'm going to go to a chiropodist in the new year. good luck, do hope it is better really soon, hugs xx
Posts.Title: Side effects of fec-t on feet and body

Posts.Content: Cheers Dreamthief, I bet the farmers did have soft hands, it is a very nice cream.  Hope you and yours have had a very nice Christmas, I'll take this chance to wish you a happy healthy New Year. keep up the good work, you are a diamond. hugs xx
Posts.Title: Side effects of fec-t on feet and body

Posts.Content: Hi Teresa, I'm Teresa to. I think it very much depends on your surgeon, I'm told some won't operate on healthy breast but my surgeon has been very sympathetic and has said he will do it for me, I am seeing him again in 3 months to tell him my decision. I'm pretty sure I'm going to have it removed. There is a face book group, I can't remember what they are called but it is for flat chested women, they say on there that you can demand the op but that isn't the way I am, I'm lucky to have an understanding surgeon. good luck with which ever way you go, stay in touch. Hugs xx Tess
Posts.Title: Just had another mastectomy without reconstruction. Anyone else decided...

Posts.Content: Hi BetE4, not sure if you have or haven't had reconstruction. I had a mastectomy nearly 18 months ago,  no reconstruction and am very nearly decided to have other breast removed, my surgeon has agreed to this but has given me longer to think it over. Not sure if this is the sort of thing you are interested to hear about xx

Posts.Title: Just had another mastectomy without reconstruction. Anyone else decided...

Posts.Content: PS I think that face book group is called flat friends, I've just put in a join request xx
Posts.Title: Just had another mastectomy without reconstruction. Anyone else decided...

Posts.Content: Really good to heat from you, I think I will be joining the flat chested brigade this year. So very difficult being lopsided. I am 71 and thought having reconstruction would be too much for me, wardrobe difficulties of course especially in this hot weather. I have just bought some breast forms from M&S and they are actually quite good, very light and fit in their post op bras well. Most of the time I am braless but do need some shape when out and about. on the whole I am doing really well, feet still a problem from the tax but can't complain too much, came through it all and am happy to be on this side of the treatments. happy to talk and exchange view, everyone on here is great. Hugs xx

Posts.Title: Just had another mastectomy without reconstruction. Anyone else decided...

Posts.Content: Hi Bunty-ann,  i have just completed my 4th FEC I start the T this week, I have found it so far not too bad have had all the side effects mentioned but none too badly, fortunately no sickness, I have to have the bone marrow injections and the blood thinning ones, was scared to death of doing them but they are fine. I think the most reassuring  thing is the speed and efficiency of the team around us when we do have a problem. So as the advice on here says, call your team if worried, listen to your body, drink LOADS of water, ginger tea is great also peppermint tea, I was told to line my tummy before chemo and exercise when you can, rest when you want. You will be fine. good luck xx
Posts.Title: Chemo consult

Posts.Content: Happiness, love and laughter all the way xx
Posts.Title: Good News Story for a cold Tuesday

Posts.Content: Signed and put on FB. Good luck x
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Well done Carolyn, looks like it will get before parliament, I have just filled in the email request for my member of parliament to attend. more power to your elbow
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Hi maxinem2, totally agree with Dreamthief to get in touch with onco unit. I was on a lower dose anyway because of age, 70 at the time, so was doing 4 fec and 4 t, after the first t I really suffered with feet and hands, shards of skin coming off both and very much the feeling in the toenails as you describe. Onco reduced dose a little more and I went weekly for 9 weeks, much easier, still not a doddle but very much as the saying on here goes 'doable' my toe nails didn't turn black but I lost a few of them, no pain and the new ones came through very quickly and look ok, I finished chemo end of august 2016 my feet are still strange and I'm told might get better might not, they are sort of numb, a weird feeling but if they stay like this it's fine, I hope they will get better but if they don't it isn't a problem, just strange. good luck and by the way I now have a really good head of 'short hair' feeling good, have my tired days but on the whole feeling good. hugs, be kind to those feet, they work hard xx
Posts.Title: Tips for a black toenail

Posts.Content: Hi me again, I forgot to say, my chemo nurse suggested urea cream for feet and hands obtainable on internet I did go for the cheapest one I could find and got from amazon can't remember name, I slathered that on night and day and when I could persuade him, got my husband to massage it in, nice and not often enough, love a foot massage :-) good luck xx
Posts.Title: Tips for a black toenail

Posts.Content: Hi always baking, I too found FEC not too bad but the T was pretty bad but I don't think I suffered as much as you are, my feet were really painful and the skin split and peeled badly also my hands so my oncologist took me off 3 weekly and put me on a weekly lower dose which although still not easy was doable, I have now completed the course, I also had the bloody nose and bowel problems but no aches and pains. Do tell your team how much you are suffering, my team assured me that the treatment I was having was just as effective. Chin up girl, this too will pass, as they say. Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Advise re being more comfortable propped up in bed !

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday hope you're feeling better now And can enjoy your weekend xx
Posts.Title: Advice on Pain Relief...

Posts.Content: I have sent the e mail to my MP so far have had the standard respons, good luck everyone
Posts.Title: Kadcyla - and other drugs - debate in parliament

Posts.Content: Great news, so pleased for you. maybe the best Christmas is on its way xx
Posts.Title: I have my results

Posts.Content: Hi, I don't very often post on here mainly because by the time I get to see the posts most of the questions have been fully answered or advice given by one or many of the brilliant people on here.  I just wanted to thank you all for all the support I feel I have received by dropping in most days and reading the posts. Dreamthief, as we all know is a legend, all of you champions are terrific, a huge thank you from me. For any new terrified members, I was diagnosed one year ago with breast cancer, had a mastectomy and all lymph nodes removed ( only one side) I had 4 FEC, 1 T, then 9 paclitaxel weekly, the T was a bit tough on me. 15 radiotherapy, 5/10 years Anastrozole. Not going to pretend it was a picnic but I got through it, I'm 71 so no spring chicken, I lost all my hair (didn't cold cap) lost all eye lashes and brows. I now have a really decent crew cut, I don't miss washing and styling my hair at all, might keep it really short and maybe a bit funky, I now have a full set of eye lashes, think they might be better than they were before and the eyebrows are back, a bit scraggy but that is over plucking not chemo, a curse from the 60's. I've been treated so well by all Doctors, nurses, everyone connected to my journey, I am so impressed with the cancer care and can't thank everyone enough. So to all of you starting on this unwanted journey, good luck, you will get through this,  I know some journeys are harder than others, I sincerely hope none of you have more than you can cope with.  Many many thanks to all on this sanity saving site. Health, happiness and Happy Christmas to you all ❤️️❤️️
Posts.Title: Thank you ALL

Posts.Content: Hi worried, so pleased you liked it, not pleased you are here to read it. Good luck, stay strong. Don't be afraid to have a dam good cry and all the help on this site is invaluable. There is always someone who knows the answer because they have probably been there. hugs
Posts.Title: Thank you ALL

Posts.Content: Defo going to try that, never expected to find recipes on here, are there no end to your talents.  Happy Christmas ❤️
Posts.Title: Xmas

Posts.Content: Sending you hugs and hopefully some strength, you're one tough cookie, sometimes letting the tears flow helps, I found tears and a scream in the shower a release.  ((((((((HUGS)))))))) and a happy sressfree New Year.  xx
Posts.Title: Will it ever end?!

Posts.Content: Gold Medal to you LondonLass, while you are here we can all keep on laughing with you and at ourselves so much better than the alternative.  Thanks and many hugs xx
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: Well done, brilliant. I am about to start the journey, so happy to read a good news story like yours, thank you. Wishing you good luck, good health and happiness for the rest of your life x
Posts.Title: RIP Cancer 12/04/15---11/02/16 I'm there! LAST TREATMENT TODAY, No...

Posts.Content: Hugs and love winging its way to you, with all the positive thoughts that are coming your way from all the people on here, you have nothing to worry about, not that you will stop.  Good luck, keep smiling ❤️️
Posts.Title: Please....not again

Posts.Content: Hi Judy, my heart goes out to you, there are times when life just sucks, you are having more than your share of bad things, as we all know the waiting is just the worse part of all this, once we know we can get on with our plan. I did my screaming in the shower and went for walks,, watched tele and crochet a lot of beanies and scarves (not very well) I put on my positive head but had trouble with the fact that people believed me, good actress or what, I think it would be good to be able to meet up with other people going through similiar treatments they really are the only people who do understand, then you can moan, rant and usually end up having a laugh. I don't think anyone on here minds us having a good rant, so fill your boots.  Wishing you and your husband good news and very good luck xx
Posts.Title: HELP! I'm turning into someone I don't know.
